item.title: Updates dear madam sir sorry to hear this but your local authority Hackney Council and local parking enforcement and metropolitan police do not care about somebody parking in your bay. They allow this criminal legal parking to take place. Hackney Council allowing residents to suffer antisocial behaviour., 11th August
item.description:
Car parking my bay for years and years.

item.title: The park outside the estate clearly states no dogs allowed. But people are bringing their dogs into the kids park and the kids are getting scared or chased. Can something be done about this please, 11th August
item.description:
The park outside the estate clearly states no dogs allowed. But people are bringing their dogs into the kids park and the kids are getting scared or chased. Can something be done about this please. Dogs of lead in gated park.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lavington Close, Hackney, London

item.title: ? Abandoned car, 11th August
item.description:
This car has been parked on the street for at least 2 months without moving. It did have some parking tickets in late June / early July, however these have now been removed. The car is in good condition but may have been abandoned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldeburgh Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Norwood Road SE27 between 385 and 389 there is, 11th August
item.description:
Norwood Road SE27 between 385 and 389 there is an alley the leads to Station Rise. Re number 8 Station Rise flats face on to said alley and two windows have been graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview looking from Norwood Road end of alley: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4392958,-0.1060786,3a,48.4y,55.63h,94.31t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sDbSXoS9txIL6_H9nMiyRxQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D-4.3099856166296036%26panoid%3DDbSXoS9txIL6_H9nMiyRxQ%26yaw%3D55.633770859377314!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDgwNi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Park Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roots damaging footway and property os 28 Wren Road, 11th August
item.description:
I reported this 2 weeks ago and there was a very basic repair - if you can call it - that to the footway. The fact remains that the tree roots have pushed up the paving and it is still dangerous as there are still broken slabs and the footway is massively uneven. If I lived at no 28 I would be livid, both with the repair and the fact that the council are ignoring the root problem
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Wren Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian button not working, 11th August
item.description:
The button hasn’t been working properly for months. The waiting light either does not come up at all, or does and disappears after a few seconds. Now the entire button has fallen off so you can’t press it at all
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanstead Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet
